tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I am forever grateful to Dr. Ankit sir for giving me a new lease on life. When I first consulted Dr. Ankit, I had lost all hope. Every doctor I had seen had told me that my condition, Avascular Necrosis of the Foot, was incurable and that I would have to learn to live with the pain for the rest of my life.

But he refused to give up on me. He took on my case with unwavering dedication and expertise, and performed a rare and complex foot surgery that no other doctor was willing to attempt. I think this is the one of the first surgery in the country.

What struck me most was his exceptional communication skills - he explained every detail in a simple, easy-to-understand way, making sure I was comfortable and informed throughout the process. He even called me personally to check on my condition, over the phone. His smile is so amazing and you will forget all your pain just by seeing his smile and kind nature.

Thanks to his tireless efforts and innovative approach, I am now pain-free after suffering for over two years. His compassion, kindness, and commitment to his patients are unparalleled. The entire staff at Sparsh Orthopedic, from the nurses to the other doctors, were supportive and kind, making my journey so much easier.

Dr. Ankit is more than just a doctor - he is a true healer. He saw beyond my diagnosis and saw me, a person in need of hope and healing. He took responsibility for my care when others wouldn't, and his expertise and skill have given me a second chance at life.

If you're struggling with a condition that seems impossible to treat, don't give up. Dr. Ankit and the team at Sparsh Orthopedic are a shining example of the power of medical excellence and compassion. I will be forever grateful for their care and recommend them to anyone seeking a doctor who truly cares.

Thank you again sir.
Very good doctor. Very friendly . Explained the problem in a nice manner. Will definitely recommend

Dr Ankit is not only a great doctor but a gem of a person. I have visited him on 3 occasions over last two years and everytime he has diagnosed and treated very well. He has gone beyond his routine engagement and treated with utmost due care. Thank you so much!

I consulted two specialists before consulting Dr. Ankit. Both of them did a wrong diagnosis and suggested a treatment which aggravated my condition. Dr. Ankit's treatment has shown improvement within a day.

Dr Ankit has helped me over the years with various bone and soft tissue injuries from playing football. He always gives detailed explanation on the issue and recommendations for physiotherapy along with treatment. I would highly recommend him for sports related injuries.

Visited the doctor due to extreme pain in left knee after meniscus repair (operation by another doctor). The doctor explained the problem and solutions in detail. He dvised medications and physiotherapy. Sh. Narendra Kumar is physiotherapist in his clinic (Rajapuri, Dwarka) and he did the job very excellent. Due to efforts of Sh. Narendra Kumar and proper advice & medicines by doctor, I am perfectly ok and living normal life. Thanks to doctor and the Physiotherapist Narendra Kumar. I recommend this clinic for best results to orho related problems. ü´°üôè

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
context: Lifestyle Disorders Treatment,Joint and Muscle Problems,
review:
Met the doctor after I had a fall with the left arms swollen. Got the xrays dine as advised by the doctor *** ** ***** *** ****** **** * *** * ******** *** ** * ****** *** *** ****** ** ** ********** ** ***** Met the doctor again after a week *** ** ***** *** *** ******* ******** *** **** advised me to apply heat on the affected area. 
Took a second opinion after around 10 days to find put that i did actually **** * ******** *** **** ** ********** ** **** 
Not happy with the diagnosis and as a result, * **** **** ****** *** **** ** **** ****
reply_text:
I have already proven my point with opinion of five other renowned doctors stating the same as I said. 
Zooming in and seeing X-rays with a microscope can over diagnose things.
Still respecting what you have been said, does anything change with respect to our line of treatment?
We advised you to rest your elbow for 3 weeks- stays same
We advised you to avoid sports, gym, weights- stays same. 
We advised you to use a sling if discomfort increase- stays same. Yes sling is optional.
You asked if you can drive with very minimal gear changes - I said yes you can- even this doesn‚Äôt change. 
Only thing required was a little patience for 3 weeks and you could have saved the time for 2nd visit and also a 3rd visit for 2 more X-rays which was not required if things were so clear in 1st x-ray it-self. 
Thanks 
In Pursuit of Excellence
Team Sparsh

review: Dr Ankit is extremely friendly and makes us comfortable during the diagnosis. He is extremely diligent and engaged in understanding the cause of the pain and does not prescribe beyond what is required.

Knowledgeable doctor with lot of patience to explain you the issues .Was very calm and attentively listened to all concerns.Explained with logic on each medicine prescribed and did not recommend any unnecessary diagnostic tests.Reminds you that genuine doctors do exist after all...

Me and my family have been consulting DrAnkit for mild to severe issues related to ortho since many years. He has always been kind enough to explain the root cause and his recommendations have been helpful in the treatment.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Dr.ankit is really a great doctor, down to earth, he has fixed my daughter radial broken bone with nail implant and removed it with great care. great and friendly staff just like himthanks üôè Dr for your Highly professional work and down to earth nature. I have visited a lot Dr. but you are really different.hope you live long.

Very happy with the doctor and the treatment offered at his clinic. Extremely no-nonsense approach, is able to pinpoint problem immediately and accurately. The physiotherapists here are also very practical and helpful. The diagnosis and treatment I recieved here has been much better and more effective than many of the more expensive and high end hospitals/clinics. A definite recommend

Dr Ankit is really good and helped me with my muscular pains and guided me on long term improvement and not just short term pain killers. Gave some physiotherapy exercises to improve muscular movements and stamina along with proper guidance on how to improve posture and reduce back pains

Dr Ankit was friendly and explained the issue and course of action properly and patiently. The clinic is run by nice and ethical people. Nobody tried to extort money for no reasons which is common everywhere these days and we absolutely loved that. The staff was nice and courteous too. Dr Ankit is very well experienced and totally recommended for his specialities by us.
Thank you Sir and team.

Overall it was a wonderful experience at Sparsh.

Dr. Ankit is very patient in listening to the problems and has a precise diagnosis. Very good experience over the last 3 months.
Very nice  explanation of the issue and i will recommend anyone for the otho problems.. I always get a good consultation from the doctor

The doctor was professional. I was in tremendous pain when I visited the doctor. The doctor was professional and gave me good treatment and the pain was significantly reduced by his treatment.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review: Doctor did a proper check up. He explained the issue and what needs to be done to cure the problem and to ensure it does not deteriorate.
He didn't explain properly how this happened  and then i asked him please explain once again then clearly said no.
reply_text:
Hi. Your relative who was a young sensible guy was explained everything in great detail and at the end of the consultation he said said sir please explain me everything again, I think he was lost somewhere. I explained him everything the 2nd time, he understood things too. Now you come in 30 minutes later and ask me to explain everything again. Common. You were wasting my time and the time of numerous other patient who were waiting outside. You should have been with the patient during the consultation. Also do not expect that all your irrelevant demand will be fulfilled just because you have paid a consultation fee. 
I think I did the right thing saying a NO. 

In Pursuit of Excellence 
Team Sparsh

review: Good consultation, properly explained, no additional treatment advised. Very supportive. And most important no extra charges.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Very polite and friendly doctor. Listens very patiently and describes the medical treatment until we are satisfied.

The doctor is very friendly and nice. However he is always late. A 10:30 am appointment would be at 11:15 or so. He also makes you buy medicines at the medicine counter at his practice. The reception staff are not really much helpful or nice. The doctor in himself is nice but seems like a cash grabber who keeps overcharging and makes you pay for every little bit of thing.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: I didn‚Äôt have a good experience first with long wait time then non convincing diagnosis *** ** *** ** ** ****** * ****** ****** **** *********** *** *********** ***** *** ***** * ***** *** *** ******* * I somewhat feel very disappointed with the doctor .
reply_text:
You came on 26th and wrote a review on 27th stating no benefit. What were you expecting, a magic.
We talked on phone on 28th regarding the reports. Have you ever seen a doctor calling up and telling you the report. Yes we do this. Did you appreciate this. No. 
Then I enquired how is your pain and you said it‚Äôs perfectly fine now. This means the diagnosis and treatment was spot on. 
Did you thank me for this. No. 
Did you even read the msg of appointment. It states that appointment comes with a wait time of 30 minutes. Your appointment was scheduled for 12:20, consultation started on 12:40 and you were out of my cabin exactly at 12:53. 
This time keeping also requires intelligence, we do not expect this precise time keeping from you, still this was just for your knowledge that we were on time. 
We serve with a smile but with smile we do not loose seriousness and professionalism. 
We take each and every ones problem seriously, how so ever small it may seem, we never take it lightly. And on top of it we do not leave your hand till your recovery is complete. We call up operated patients to enquire about their well being. Ever seen any one do this. Despite being very busy we do it everyday. 
There are 2 kind of person we never want to treat
1. Thankless people.
2. People without sympathy and empathy. (Your tone for the reception staff- hum jaise professional log ko wo samjha rahe hai)
We regret having treated you. 
All the best with Thanks and Empathy

In pursuit of excellence 
Team Sparsh.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: The Dr is friendly, and explains the issue well. I found that his support team to be not well trained, polite and cooperative. They insist on taking the medicines from their hospital pharmacy. The prescription wasn't legible (the chemist could not decipher it) and the support staff refused to clarify the medicine names with the Dr.
reply_text:
Hi. Thanks for your valuable feedback. Well we really insist on taking medicines from in-house pharmacy and the whole purpose of this is to decrease your hassle of roaming from pharmacy to pharmacy and getting irritated. Then calling us and asking to make the pharmacist understand the medicines. Pharmacist will not have the same medicine then asking to give a supplement. Just imagine how much time and energy is wasted in all this. Just imagine the chaos for us after seeing more than 50 patients daily and 50% patients calling up for medicines alone. All wants branded medicines we give branded only. All wants discount on medicine we give that also. After all this I could never understand why one wants to roam around with the prescription which has the tried and tested medicines to suit you best with least side effects and ending up with over the counter medicines.  

Thanks 
In pursuit of excellence
Team Sparsh

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,

reply_text:
Thoda patience rakho bhai. 
Again We would enlighten the fact that it is not a corporate office meeting appointment. It‚Äôs a doctors appointment and waiting time can increase significantly on occasional days. Any walk in patient coming to hospital doesn‚Äôt come to enjoy a pizza. They are also in pain and they need to be  respected too. 
5:30 to 6:15 all appointments came in late and all arrived around 6:15. Just imagine the amount of time wasted and chaos created. And also think about who created it. Also if you can think about the solution to this I would love to have it. Should we send them back, or give a negative recommendation to patients coming late. 
We did not make you wait doing something not meant to be done during OPD hours. We did not make you wait sipping a coffee and chatting with friends. We were working at highest level of professionalism taking care of every one the perfect timers, the walkins and the late comers and yes without compromising on the time and quality of consultation. 
I guess you forgot to mention about your experience with the doctor, the quality of consultation, advice and medication given? 
Or maybe the stresses of delay was so much that all the positives were forgotten.
Where-in every one waited with patience. 
All that was needed was a little patience.
After getting your tennis elbow fixed will surely have a game of tennis someday. 
In Pursuit of Excellence
Team Sparsh
